intro: Pseudogynoxys filicalyculata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pseudogynoxys, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are narrow and often hairy, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. It is a perennial herb that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
